recipes.title: Baked Chicken Thighs with Spiced Tomato Rub
directions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, whisk together olive oil, tomato paste, smoked paprika, cumin, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper (if using).
Add the garlic and lemon juice to the bowl and mix well.
Add the chicken thighs to the bowl and coat them evenly with the spice mixture.
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil or parchment paper and arrange the chicken thighs on it.
Bake for about 35-40 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
Garnish with parsley before serving.

recipes.title: Crispy Olive Oil Fried Brussels Sprouts
ingredients: 1 pound Brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
directions: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the Brussels sprouts to the skillet and cook for about 5 minutes on each side, or until they are golden brown and crispy.
Season with salt, black pepper, and red pepper flakes (if using).
Stir in garlic and cook for another minute.
Squeeze lemon juice over the Brussels sprouts and toss to coat.
Garnish with parsley before serving.

recipes.title: Greek-Style Baked Feta Recipe
directions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place the feta cheese on a baking dish.
Drizzle olive oil over the feta, then sprinkle garlic, lemon juice, parsley, dill, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes (if using) on top.
Bake for about 15-20 minutes or until the feta is slightly melted and fragrant.
Serve warm with bread or crackers.

recipes.title: Mezze Platter with Hummus and Roasted Eggplant
ingredients: Traditional Creamy Hummus or store-bought alternative
Homemade Roasted Red Pepper Hummus or store-bought alternative
Homemade Greek Tzatziki or store-bought tzatziki
6 California fresh figs, halved (or seedless grapes)
Pita bread or rustic European bread
directions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place the eggplant slices on paper towels, sprinkle with salt, and let them 'sweat out' any bitterness for 20 minutes. Pat dry.
Roast the eggplant slices on a lightly oiled baking pan for 20 minutes, or until medium-brown. Sprinkle with sumac.
Assemble the mezze platter with hummus spreads, tzatziki sauce in the cored bell pepper, and arrange the remaining ingredients.
Serve with warm pita bread or crostini.

recipes.title: Apple Walnut Salad
ingredients: 1/4 cup Deglet Noor or Medjool dates, pitted and sliced lengthwise into thin strips
1 Pink Lady or Gala apple, cored and thinly sliced
directions: Toast the nuts: Preheat an oven or toaster oven to 350°F. Spread 1/2 cup walnuts on a small baking sheet and bake until they turn golden brown and smell toasty, about 10 minutes. Let cool completely before roughly chopping.

Make the Apple Cider Vinaigrette: In a small bowl, whisk together 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar, 1 tablespoon honey, and 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard. Stir in 1 minced garlic clove. Then, whisking continuously, slowly drizzle in 1/2 cup olive oil until fully emulsified. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Slice the endive: Rinse 2 medium heads of endive under cold, running water and pat dry. Clean and dry 2 ounces of arugula if necessary. Slice the endive in half lengthwise. With a sharp paring knife, make a small, triangular notch to remove the cores. Then, slice endive quarters crosswise into strips and transfer them to a large salad bowl or serving platter. Mix in the arugula.

Mix: Pit and slice 1/4 cup dates lengthwise into thin strips and sprinkle on the salad. Cut 1 apple into thin slices and add to the bowl. Add the toasted walnuts and sprinkle with half of the chevre cheese (about 1 1/2 ounces).
Dress: Drizzle 2-3 tablespoons of the Apple Cider Vinaigrette over the salad and toss gently.
Serve: Divide the salad among plates and top with the remaining chevre cheese. Season with a pinch of salt and more ground pepper if desired.
